intro: Tournefortia oblongata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features opposite, oblong leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a yellow or white color. Tournefortia oblongata is adapted to well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or riverine habitats.
